DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine efficacious transmission block drug regimen seasonal malaria chemoprophylaxis Mali . The primary outcome measure proportion mosquito infect pre post-treatment , assess membrane feeding measure oocyst prevalence mosquito dissect day 7 post feed . Primary endpoint within group comparison mean pretreatment infectivity ( Day 0 ) infectivity 7 day post first dose .
DOC.brief_title: Phase 2 Efficacy Study Primaquine Methylene Blue
DOC.criteria: Glucose6phosphate dehydrogenase ( G6PD ) normal define CareStart™ G6PD rapid diagnostic test ( RDT ) OSMMR2000 G6PD semiqualitative test Absence symptomatic falciparum malaria , define fever upon enrollment Presence P. falciparum gametocyte thick blood film density > 30 gametocytes/µL ( i.e . ≥2 gametocyte record thick film 500 white blood cell ) No allergy study drug No selfreported use antimalarial drug past 7 day ( report participant ) Hemoglobin ≥ 10 g/dL Individuals weigh < 80 kg No evidence severe chronic disease Written , inform consent Age < 5 year > 50 year Female gender Blood thick film negative sexual stage malaria Previous reaction study drugs/known allergy study drug Signs severe malaria , include hyperparasitemia , define asexual parasitemia > 100,000 parasite / µL ) Signs acute chronic illness , include hepatitis Use medication ( exception paracetamol and/or aspirin ) Consent give
